sections.title: Welcome to FTC Java Programming
sections.content: This comprehensive curriculum is designed for students with a solid Java background who want to learn FTC (FIRST Tech Challenge) robotics programming. The curriculum is structured in three progressive tiers, each building upon the previous level.

sections.title: Curriculum Structure
items: Beginner Tier: Focus on OnBot Java development with simple concepts and immediate feedback
Intermediate Tier: Introduction to Android Studio, Git version control, and more complex programming patterns
Advanced Tier: Advanced autonomous systems, computer vision, and competition strategies
sections.subtitle: Our curriculum follows a progressive learning path designed to take you from basic robot control to advanced autonomous systems.

sections.title: Prerequisites
sections.content: Before starting this curriculum, you should have:

items: Solid understanding of Java programming fundamentals
Basic knowledge of object-oriented programming concepts
Basic knowledge of arrays and data structures

sections.title: Learning Resources
sections.content: This curriculum is based on the following authoritative sources:

items: Game Manual 0 (gm0.org) - Official FTC documentation and best practices
FIRST Technology Information - Official FIRST resources and documentation
KookyBotz GitHub - Advanced FTC programming examples and libraries
PedroPathing - Advanced autonomous path following library
Seattle Solvers Documentation - Advanced FTC programming resources

sections.title: Development Environments
items: OnBot Java: Web-based development environment perfect for beginners and rapid prototyping
Android Studio: Professional IDE for advanced development with full debugging capabilities
sections.subtitle: You'll learn to work with two main development environments:

sections.title: Getting Started
sections.content: Start with the Beginner Tier if you're new to FTC programming. Each lesson includes hands-on exercises and example code. Make sure to complete the exercises and experiment with the provided code examples.
